title: An unknown directx error has occurred and league of legends cannot start
body: "unknown directx error has occurred and league of legends cannot start" comes up after champ select saying to update my video card drivers, the client works fine but I cant get into a game. Ive tried updating my drivers from the NVIDIA website which did not work, Ive re-installed League, i tried .NET Framework, nothing sems to be working, any help would be nice

replies.body:
Hey Dominator!

This generally happens when your DirectX is not up to date. You can find the most up to date version of DirectX [here!](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)

Please let me know if you have any questions.

hello, i'm asking you here since i hope its faster than support, i just updated lol(700mb update) and now i get this error mentioned above, i would deeply appreciate help asap
{{champion:32}} i need my leg back(using a laptop, my DirectX and intel drivers are up to date )
Im sorry forgot to mention, my directX is up to date
i download this and they said me: an internal system error occurred why^

Hey there,
I had the same problem in the past few days. I installed win10 on my laptop and this window popped up every time I started the game.
My solution: I boot LoL from the lol.launcher.admin.
My graphics card driver and DirectX are up to date.
(I set my Nvidia GPU to default GPU).

> [{quoted}](name=csumpulu,realm=EUNE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=fIkPvA81,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-10-09T11:21:33.534+0000)
>
> Hey there,
> I had the same problem in the past few days. I installed win10 on my laptop and this window popped up every time I started the game.
> My solution: I boot LoL from the lol.launcher.admin.
> My graphics card driver and DirectX are up to date.
> (I set my Nvidia GPU to default GPU).

This is late, but this worked for me thank you so much!

Could someone help me out? My hard drive broke recently and we bought a new one, now when we installed Windows 7 yesterday, it seems all clunky and weird. League opens normally, champ select it normal, but when the game launches it crashes and it opens a window with "Error directX cant launch blabla"

You'll probably want to create a ticket for the Tech team so they can look into this for you, but you'll wanna attach your logs.

Logs: 
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs

Ticket:
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

I don't know if you still have this problem, but I had the same experience as you. The way I fixed it **permanently ** was I changed the graphic processor.
I.E - I right clicked on league on it had this option "Run with graphics processor". My default processor was "NVIDIA" and I switched it over to "Integrated Graphics". That fixes the problem. Hope this helps you.
That really helped me out a ton!! Thank you so much!!
you are the best!!!! i did everything to fix the problem, but nothing worked out. TYTYTYTYTYTYTYTYTYTYTYTY
Where did u right click. The desktop icon or a file in riot games folder?
thank you soooooooo much it really helped me a lot!!!!
I have a same problem! I updated drivers , windows , reinstall the game and nothing! Please help i will be grateful.

I've been having the same error. I have a laptop with a  Nvidia 640M LE and an integrated Intel 4000 chip. I could force the game to run on the integrated chip but kept getting the DirectX error every time I tried launching with the Nvidia 640M LE. 

Here is one potential solution:
Disable Displaylink Driver. There is a known conflict between Displaylink Drivers and DirectX. If you use a USB dock that uses Displaylink drivers OR if your computer manufacturer automatically installed Displaylink drivers on there, then you may experience this problem. 

Here is the link for the tool that will allow you to Enable and Disable Displaylink Drivers without having to uninstall them:

http://www.displaylink.com/support/ticket.php?id=368 

This error affects many other games as well. If you would like to read more about it:

http://www.displaylink.org/forum/archive/index.php/t-61962.html 

Hope that helps someone else!
